concept.title: Localize Strings
concept.shortdesc: Customizing the strings of the Livefyre Apps.

conbody.p: The text strings for most HTML elements in any Livefyre App may be customized. This provides the flexibility to change the text of rendered HTML elements, such as the “Post As” button, the “Comment Count” text, or the “Sign In” button, to any valid UTF-8 string. Use this feature to add personality to your implementation of the stream, or to localize the language in the app for your user base.

ul.li:
Comments, Chat, and Live Blog
Stream Info
Stream Sorting
Content Info
Featured Content
Text Editor
Response Options
Comment Notifier
Error Messages

section.title: Implementation
section.p: To implement this feature, pass in a 1-1 object mapping of the strings you wish to override to the JavaScript configuration object. If you don’t provide a field, then the default text will be used.
Example:
This page lists all text strings which may be customized for the Livefyre Core Apps.

section.title: Account Access
section.p: Strings available for the Authentication process, and from the authenticated user menus.

section.title: Stream Info
section.p: Strings available for content stream information and display. Lists the number of people listening, the number of posts to the App, and allows users to sign in, or access their account information.

section.title: Stream Sorting
section.p: Allows uses to sort returned content by age or popularity.

row.entry: There are not enough likes yet.
There are not enough threads yet.

section.title: Content Info
section.p: Lists post information: user name, any applied user tags, and post time.

row.entry: This comment is no longer visible.

section.title: Featured Content
section.p: If enabled, featured content is listed at the top of the stream.

section.title: Text Editor
section.p: By default, available at the top of the page for all users.

row.entry: This conversation is currently closed to new comments.

section.title: Response Options
section.p: Unless otherwise noted, available to all logged in users. Mouse over a content panel to access.

row.entry: editButton(Available only for authors and moderators, if enabled.)
deleteButton(Available only for authors and moderators, if enabled.)
replyButtonSingular(Available for Chat and Live Blog.)
replyButtonPlural(Available for Chat and Live Blog.)
I just posted a comment. Check it out!
backToComments(Appears above reply modal for featured content.)
I mentioned you in a Livefyre comment!
Oops! Something went wrong! Livefyre has been alerted.
You must have at least one mention enabled.
To see and mention your friends
Available to Studio Admins, User Managers or Moderators
customHtmlDialogTitle(Appears as the header for the modal.)
Available to Studio Admins, User Managers or Moderators.
Available to Studio Admins, User Managers or Moderators.
Are you sure you want to ban this user?

section.title: Comment Notifier
section.p: If enabled, available at the bottom of the page for all Livefyre conversation Apps.

section.title: Error Messages
section.p: Strings available for customizable error messages.

You must change the body of the comment when you edit it.

It seems you’re attempting to post an empty comment.
Your session has expired. Please reload the page.
Sorry, only those with accounts can like content.
It seems you’re attempting to post an invalid character.
You cannot like your own comment
It seems you’re attempting to post malformed content.
Sorry, your comment is too long. Please edit and try again.
There was an error loading more comments.
Your permissions only grant you one media attachment at a time.

section.title: Time and Date Format
section.p: Translate and customize how dates appear on content cards within visualization apps.

row.entry: January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December
Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec

section.p: Strings available for the Media Wall App.
